metadata.title: CVE-2015-4522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The nsUnicodeToUTF8::GetMaxLength function in Mozilla Firefox before 41.0and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.3 might allow remote attackers to cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via unknown vectors, related to an"overflow."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
